intro: Chaenorhinum villosum subsp. villosum, commonly known as the hairy horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a rough, textured appearance. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
